verses.text: 但願我的頭是水井，我的眼是淚的泉源；我好為我同胞（「同胞」原文作「人民的女子」）中被殺的，晝夜哭泣。

words.note: Lit. 'of the same womb'. Contextually 'people'.

verses.text: 但願我在曠野有一個旅客住宿的地方，好使我離開我的同胞，可以離他們而去；因為他們都是行姦淫的，是行詭詐之徒。

words.note: Emphasizes leaving definitely.
Used to link noun phrases or adjective-noun.
Here, refers to 'those who are (deceitful)'.

verses.text: 「他們彎曲舌頭，像彎弓一樣；在這地得勢的是虛謊，不是誠實；因為他們變本加厲地作惡，連我也不認識。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Idiom: to become worse and worse.

verses.heading: The Lord Laments That He Has No Choice But to Judge Them

verses.text: 「你們各人要提防自己的鄰舍，不要信靠兄弟；因為每一個兄弟都在欺騙人，每一個鄰舍都搬弄是非。

words.note: Idiom: lit. 'move right and wrong'.

verses.text: 他們各人都欺騙自己的鄰舍，不說誠實話。他們訓練自己的舌頭說謊話，竭力作孽，以致他們不能回轉（按照《馬索拉抄本》，本句意思難確定；現參照《七十士譯本》翻譯）。
欺凌加上欺凌，詭詐加上詭詐（按照《馬索拉文本》，「欺凌加上欺凌，詭詐加上詭詐」作「你的住所在詭詐中；在詭詐裡」;現參照《七十士譯本》翻譯），他們不肯認識我。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Often implies injustice or exploitation.
Implies a deceptive and malicious nature.
The authoritative Hebrew and Aramaic text of the Tanakh.
Often follows a noun to indicate 'in' or 'among'.
Ancient Greek translation of the Hebrew Bible.
The personal name of God in the Hebrew Bible.
Often used for a formal, authoritative statement, especially from God.

verses.text: 因此，萬軍之耶和華這樣說：「看哪！我要熬煉他們，試驗他們；因我子民（「我子民」原文作「我子民的女子」）的罪惡，我還可以作甚麼呢？

words.note: A divine title emphasizing God's sovereignty over heavenly and earthly forces.
An exclamation used to draw attention, common in biblical texts.
Indicates intention or future action.
Often used metaphorically for testing and purifying people's character.
Refers to the chosen people of God.
Often used for 'daughters' in a collective or familial sense.
Strongly denotes moral transgression against God or humanity.
Indicates a question or rhetorical question, sometimes implying challenge.

verses.text: 他們的舌頭是殺人的利箭，嘴裡說的是詭詐；跟鄰舍說話滿口甜言蜜語，心底裡卻設計陷害他。

words.note: A verb-object compound functioning as a descriptive adjective here.
Used to link a descriptive phrase to a noun.
Metaphor for words that wound or kill.
Used to emphasize or nominalize the preceding verb phrase.
Frequently appears in biblical moral injunctions.
Implies speaking a lot of something, often negative or insincere.
Refers to deceptive or insincere pleasant talk.
Can imply a cunning or malicious plan.

verses.text: 我因這些事怎能不懲罰他們呢？像這樣的國家，我怎能不親自報復呢？」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Rhetorical question particle implying impossibility or strong disapproval.

verses.text: 我要為眾山哭泣哀號，為曠野的草場唱哀歌；因為都已成為荒涼，無人經過，也聽不到牲畜的叫聲；無論空中的飛鳥，地上的走獸，都逃走跑掉了。

words.note: A common setting for biblical narratives and prophecies.
Songs of sorrow or mourning, often found in prophetic books and Psalms.
Often used in biblical contexts to distinguish from birds or creeping things.
Indicates successful escape or disappearance by running.
Indicates completion of an action or change of state.

verses.heading: The Coming Destruction Calls For Mourning

verses.text: 「我要使耶路撒冷變成亂堆，成為野狗的巢穴；我要使猶大的城市荒涼，無人居住。」

words.note: A heap of disorder, suggesting utter destruction.

verses.text: 誰是智慧人可以解明這事？耶和華的口向誰說過，以致他可以傳講這事？為甚麼這地被毀壞，像曠野般荒涼，無人經過呢？

words.note: Often used in a biblical context to refer to those with spiritual wisdom.

words.definition: so that, with the result that

verses.text: 耶和華說：「這是因為他們離棄了我擺在他們面前的律法，不聽從我的話，沒有遵行我的律法；

words.note: Often used in biblical context for forsaking God.
Refers specifically to God's law or commandments in scripture.
Often used in religious contexts regarding adherence to laws or commands.
Refers specifically to God's law or commandments in scripture.

verses.text: 反而隨從自己頑梗的心行事，照他們列祖所教訓的，隨從眾巴力。」

words.note: Often used to describe a stubbornly rebellious heart in biblical texts.
Here '眾' (all/many) indicates 'the Baals' or 'many Baals'.

verses.text: 因此，萬軍之耶和華以色列的 神這樣說：「看哪！我要使這人民吃苦堇，喝毒水。

words.note: A divine title for God, emphasizing His power over armies/heavenly beings.
Capitalized '神' when referring to the one true God.
An exclamation used in scripture to draw attention to a significant statement.
A bitter herb, often used symbolically in the Bible for bitterness and sorrow.
Figurative language for punishment and suffering.

verses.text: 我要把他們分散在列國中，就是他們和他們的列祖都不認識的列國；我要使刀劍追殺他們，直到把他們滅絕。」

words.note: Indicates object is acted upon
Often refers to Gentile nations in biblical context.
Connects an attribute to a noun

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華這樣說：「你們要思想，要把唱哀歌的婦女召來，把那些擅長哀哭的婦女請來；

words.note: A divine title for God, emphasizing His supreme power.

verses.text: 叫他們趕快為我們舉哀，使我們的眼流下眼淚，使我們的眼皮湧出淚水。
因為從錫安可以聽到哀聲，說：『我們何等衰敗！我們多麼羞恥！因我們丟棄了這地，我們的家園被拆毀了。』」
婦女們哪！你們要聽耶和華的話，你們的耳朵要領受他口中的話；要教導你們的女兒舉哀，各人要彼此學習哀歌。

words.note: Often implies receiving a teaching or command.
Literally 'in the mouth of', idiomatically 'from the mouth of'.

verses.text: 因為死亡從窗戶上來，進入我們的堡壘；要從街上剪除孩童，從廣場上剪除年輕人。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix here.

verses.text: 你要這樣說（這是耶和華的宣告）：「人的屍體橫臥著，像田野上的糞肥，又像遺留在收割者後面的麥穗，無人拾取。」

words.note: Used as a locative suffix here.
'收割' means 'to harvest'; '者' indicates 'person'.

verses.text: 耶和華這樣說：「智慧人不可誇耀自己的智慧，勇士不可誇耀自己的勇力，財主不可誇耀自己的財富。
誇口的卻要因了解我，認識我而誇口；認識我是耶和華，我在地上施行慈愛、公正、公義；因為我喜悅這些事。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Verb-object compound, lit. 'boast mouth'.
Verb-object compound, lit. 'boast mouth'.

words.definition: to be pleased with, delight in

verses.text: 「看哪！日子快到（這是耶和華的宣告），我必懲罰所有只在身體受過割禮，內心卻未受割禮的人，

words.note: Commonly used in biblical text for emphasis.

verses.text: 就是埃及、猶大、以東、亞捫、摩押和所有剃除鬢髮，住在曠野的人；因為列國的人都沒有受過割禮，甚至以色列全家的內心也沒有受過割禮。」

words.note: Refers to the practice of shaving hair at the temples, often forbidden for Israelites.
Often refers to the Gentile nations in the Bible.
`過` indicates a past experience.
Literally 'cutting ritual'.
`過` indicates a past experience.
Literally 'cutting ritual'.
